awd_titl_txt: Sixth, Seventh, Eighth & Ninth Vermont Summer Workshops     on Combinatorics & Graph Theory
awd_abstract_narration: 9403031  Archdeacon       The Sixth Vermont Summer Workshops on Combinatorics and  graph theory will be held at the University of Vermont this  summer.  Its purpose is to provide a productive setting for the   interchange of ideas, to support collaborative research, and to   help in the dissemination of new results and techniques.       Combinatorics and Graph Theory involve the systematic study  of the simplest mathematical objects.  At its heart,   Combinatorics involves counting,  but counting objects that are  too numerous or complicated to list. Graphs are simple diagrams  where points are connected by lines.  It is the very simplicity  of the basic ideas of Combinatorics and Graph Theory that make  them so important to all sorts of scientists from chemists to  electrical engineers.
